physical_examinations.relevant_findings: A 35-year-old woman presented with pain, swelling, erythema, and purulent drainage on the dorsum of her left long finger. The infection was found to be a subcutaneous abscess with surrounding necrotic tissue.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Inflammation and pain had resolved at follow-up 10 days after discharge.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: A 21-year-old man presented with significant pain, swelling, erythema, and discharge from two open wounds on his left index and middle fingers. No involvement of tendon, bone, or joint was noted.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: By follow-up two weeks later, the patient was nearly healed with no tenderness, erythema, drainage, or discharge.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: A 13-month-old girl had erythema and exudate near the skin-graft site with cultures positive for community-acquired methicillin-resistant S. aureus.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Resolved inflammatory sinus with complete graft healing after treatment.
